channel.title: Jira
channel.description: An XML representation of a search request

item.title: [ERLLM-144] er-dob-extractor Address Issues / Improve Recall
item.description:
https://www.notion.so/xapien/er-dob-extractor-evaluation-december-2025-1591edcf1daa807b8437d3e27ab91501

Running content tests (n=120) made it apparent that the service misses lots of dates of birth. This is because it appears the way dates appear in text is often very different to what we expect.

The service does not seem to struggle with false positives. So when it gives us something, that something appears (from my testing) to be always correct.

Some linked tickets from Harrison

  • Have seen false positives in the wild causing issues - but they are rare.
    e.g. known hard underlink caused by incorrect DoB extraction https://digital-insight.atlassian.net/browse/ERAC-145
  • Also a known issue in our DoB handling logic which is overly sensitive to "VeryGood" quality dates https://digital-insight.atlassian.net/browse/ERAC-320
  • And the mistakesAllowed logic isn't perfect https://digital-insight.atlassian.net/browse/ERAC-325

New note from Jonah (19/12/2024)

Current System

Input -> Current Output of DOB service
Robert Arthur Kardashian (born 01/02/2000) -> somePointIn(2000-01-02/2000-01-02)
Robert Arthur Kardashian (born 02/01/2000) -> somePointIn(2000-02-01/2000-02-01)

This seems wrong. We don’t know if it is DD/MM/YYYY or MM/DD/YYYY. Whoever picks up this ticket, you need to figure out from the right person (probably Joseph) what the desired behaviour is here.

item.title: [ERLLM-143] MLB 'proxies' issue service checking
item.description:
Background: https://www.notion.so/xapien/MLB-unexpected-argument-proxies-15e1edcf1daa801ba221d3b2be14d8db

Jonah’s Review: https://www.notion.so/xapien/Jonah-s-notes-on-MLB-upgrades-15e1edcf1daa809b9839de22fbab530a

Jonah will check to ensure all of the required services have the MLB upgrade

item.title: [ERLLM-142] er-dre-extractor Investigate Consistency Issues
item.description:
https://www.notion.so/xapien/er-dre-extractor-3-5-4o-mini-swapover-1591edcf1daa80a484f9fa5371bcf533

It appears that currently the dre extraction service is quite inconsistent. We see lots of differences between runs. We should determine if this is important, and if it is look at coming up with fixes for it.

→ Make a second call to the model asking to confirm this is all the dres

→ Make multiple calls in parallel and aggregate results

→ limit the document size that goes in, if it is determined that it is long documents resulting in us missing some dres

item.title: [ERLLM-141] er-aka-extractor Anchor Terms Handling
item.description:
The way we handle anchor terms in er-aka-extractor is a bit weird.

If an anchor term appears in the text, we dump all anchor terms into a user prompt to look for AKAs.

This should instead probably only pass the AKA which was hit. Then we can also log which aka it was that was hit more cleanly.

https://github.com/Digital-Insight-Technologies-Ltd/er-aka-extractor/blob/main/er_aka_extractor/src/prompt_building_and_parsing.py#L28

item.title: [ERLLM-140] er-detailed-summary-generator Redo Prompting
item.description:
Some things to look at:

  • often the response starts with “the article states that …”. Do we want this?
  • should probably split to system and user prompt
  • it will waffle for people. For the input
"David schwimmer is the CEO of LSEG."

We get the output 

"david schwimmer is the ceo of lseg (london stock exchange group). the article highlights his leadership role within the organization, indicating that he is at the helm of one of the world's leading financial market infrastructure and data providers. as ceo, schwimmer is likely responsible for overseeing the strategic direction and operational management of lseg, which plays a crucial role in facilitating global financial markets. his position suggests that he is involved in key decision-making processes that impact the company's performance and its contributions to the financial industry."

This uses information outwith the article.

Prompt changes should be regression tested!

item.title: [ERLLM-139] er-detailed-summary-matcher Better Testing
item.description:
see https://www.notion.so/xapien/er-detailed-summary-matcher-notes-1571edcf1daa8068b475f536b5427228

Things we want to do:

  • Get a real enquiry test case
  • Better test cases for people

As suggested by Juan Coquet some more improvements to testing should be:

  • ensure tests use redis docker container with localhost (instead of reading from env)
  • tests should spin up and down redis docker container as required
